About SGU.description: Swiss German University (SGU) was established in 2000 as a joint effort between Indonesia, Germany, Switzerland, and Austria. SGU is the pioneer in offering international curricula in Indonesia. Qualified students can graduate with a Double Degree from Indonesia and Germany, which SGU provides in cooperation with partner universities.
About SGU.vision: To be a globally recognized university with integrity, superior learning culture, diversity, and high social responsibility, which inspires character transformation and develops young leaders who are responsible and fully equipped to face life’s challenges.
mission: Placing discipline and integrity as core values in every activity to develop character transformation of the civitas academica.
Organizing an internationally oriented education with a high-quality learning culture that focuses on professionalism, innovation, and excellence.
Carrying out globally recognized research emphasizing the advancement of science and its application.
Carrying out community service and playing an active role in society as a form of social care and dedication to Indonesia.

Mechatronics Engineering.description: Mechatronics refers to an integrated approach to the multi-disciplinary field involving mechanical engineering, electronics, and computer sciences. The applications of this field are numerous, ranging from manufacturing automation to smart product designs. Our graduates are able to modernize older technological capabilities to take products and manufacturing to the next level.

Hybrid Electric Vehicles.description: Studying Hybrid Electric Vehicles is not just about following technological trends; it also provides the ability to adapt to industrial changes and make a positive contribution to global challenges related to transportation and the environment. The Hybrid Electric Vehicles program prepares students to become professionals who can contribute to the development and implementation of sustainable and environmentally friendly transportation solutions. Additionally, the program often includes practical projects and collaborations with the automotive industry to provide students with hands-on experience.

IT: Cyber Security.description: A cybersecurity major immerses students in cutting-edge digital defense, integrating emerging technologies like AI and blockchain to counter evolving threats. Emphasizing ethical hacking, students learn to identify vulnerabilities, navigating legal frameworks in simulated cyber-attacks. In-depth malware analysis equips them to dissect and counter malicious code, while cyber threat intelligence training enables proactive strategies against potential threats. This comprehensive skill set prepares graduates to safeguard digital infrastructure effectively. Armed with expertise in emerging technologies, ethical hacking, malware analysis, and cyber threat intelligence, they navigate the dynamic cybersecurity landscape adeptly, making them valuable assets in defending against diverse cyber threats.

IT: Artificial Intelligence & Data Scien.description: Artificial intelligence has actually become something that we usually encounter through today’s technological sophistication, for example, the computer vision application on the Electronic Traffic Law Enforcement (e-tilang) system in Jakarta that uses smart cameras. In addition there are many other things such as Natural Language Processing, Image Processing, Pattern Recognition, and many more. In today’s world, data science also has a big role to predict information and generate useful insights for various fields, such as decision making in business, politics, health, etc. Committed as a university that always aligns with industry demands, Swiss German University is ready to facilitate these needs through the Information Technology – Artificial Intelligence & Data Science study program. The latest added value is SGU’s collaboration with the University of Missouri Kansas City (UMKC) to provide a fast-track program.

IT: Technopreneurship.description: Many applications today have been extensively equipped with Artificial Intelligence (AI) capability, which makes them more interesting and useful. Besides, the amount of data that is generated online everyday is enormous. This huge amount of data, termed with Big Data, is of little use unless it is processed to produce useful insights for business, government, education, society, and research. Moreover, IT and the Internet have opened big opportunities for many to become IT Entrepreneurs. Many millennial and Z generation students have been attracted to entrepreneurship. Entrepreneurship and Startup have become a jargon in almost all educational institutions. SGU Bachelor IT has been in the forefront in providing IT skills since the beginning. We constantly adapt our teaching to align with the demand of industry. As we have highlighted above, the need for AI and Data Scientists as well as IT Entrepreneurs is increasing, which is why our new curriculum offered in 2020 includes these two concentrations: AI and Data Science, and IT Technopreneurship. The latest added value is SGU’s collaboration with the University of Missouri Kansas City (UMKC) to provide a fast-track program.

IE: Smart Industry.description: Artificial intelligence (AI) and data analytics have become new alternative methods that are frequently used for systems optimization in the era of Industry 4.0, for example in process automation, e-commerce, business intelligence and analytics, and predictive maintenance. Utilizing AI and data analytics for improving engineering and business systems requires good understanding and competences in operations management, logistics and supply chain, human factors, economy, and optimization methods. These competences assure that the investment on new sophisticated technology implementation could lead the organization to higher performance and efficiency, along with better sustainability. In order to support the Indonesian government’s initiatives in Industry 4.0 and circular economy, along with the needs of digital talents that are rising in the future of work, Industrial Engineering: Smart Industry of Swiss German University provides a curriculum and conducts collaborative programs with industry and partner universities aligned with the needs of human capital that have competences to optimize the performance of engineering and business systems using artificial intelligence and data analytics. The latest added value is SGU’s collaboration with the University of Missouri Kansas City (UMKC) to provide a fast-track program.

IE: Eco Industry.description: The emerging world issues related to sustainability drive industries to achieve cleaner production. With the use of modern tools, concepts, methods, and technologies, green engineering and technology help build sustainable and eco-friendly designs and innovations. The concept aligns with the United Nations 2030 agenda for sustainable development goals. In accordance with this issue, Industrial Engineering: Eco Industry of Swiss German University directs students to have a sustainable mindset based on economic, environmental, and social perspectives. The field of study includes green economy, circular economy, supply chain management, lean operations, and maintenance management, and is equipped with knowledge from digital and technological aspects such as artificial intelligence (AI) and data analytics. This set of competences ensures that graduates are well-prepared for the competitive industrial market, especially in the face of the Industry 4.0 era. The latest added value is SGU’s collaboration with the University of Missouri Kansas City (UMKC) to provide a fast-track program.

Business and Management.description: The Business Management Study Program offers three concentrations: Digital Marketing, Finance and Business Analytic, and Innovative Entrepreneurship. Each of these concentrations provides the necessary knowledge, skills, and confidence to succeed in management roles. Students are also enriched with International Certification, Entrepreneurship Development Program, and International Computer-Based training to thrive in a constantly changing and competitive global business environment.

career_prospects: Managerial positions in multinational companies (BMW, Siemens, DBS, Ernst & Young, Coca-Cola)

Business Accounting.description: The Business Accounting program at Swiss German University is designed to prepare students with practical and industry-relevant accounting skills. The curriculum aligns with professional standards and emphasizes hands-on experience through internships in both public accounting firms (KAP) and non-KAP companies. Students gain exposure to modern accounting tools such as SAP, audit applications, and Accurate, ensuring readiness for real-world challenges and opportunities for international certification.
lecturers: Dr. Nila Krisnawati Hidayat, SE., MM.
Agung Joni Saputra, S.E., M.Akt., Cert DA.
Dr. Nurdayadi, MSc.
Alfiandri, MAcc. CA

Digital Communication & Media Arts.description: The Digital Communication & Media Arts (DCMA) program at Swiss German University combines creativity, digital media, arts, technology, and strategic communication. Offered under a 2+2 Double Degree scheme with Ming Chuan University in Taipei, students spend two years at SGU and two years at MCU. The curriculum emphasizes digital content creation, multimedia production, digital marketing, visual communication, and media strategy through hands-on projects, internships, and international exposure to prepare graduates for a dynamic, tech-driven communications industry.
lecturers: Dr. Nila Krisnawati Hidayat, SE., MM.
Loina Lalolo Krina Perangin-angin, M.Si.
Deborah Nauli S., Ph.D.

Digital Communication & Media.description: The Digital Communication & Media program at Swiss German University equips students with essential skills to excel in a digital-first world. The curriculum covers digital communication strategies, media technology, and information systems, emphasizing public relations, digital journalism, digital marketing, multimedia content production, and media management. Students engage in hands-on learning through internships and research while gaining a global perspective in SGU’s multicultural environment.
lecturers: Dr. Nila Krisnawati Hidayat, SE., MM — Dean of Faculty of Business and Communication
Loina Lalolo Krina Perangin-angin, M.Si.

Global Strategic Communication.description: The Global Strategic Communication curriculum focuses on combining the study of media technology, public relations, journalism, strategic communications, and culture with a strong emphasis on international exposure. SGU prepares students with extensive global experience in language, culture, learning materials, lecturers, internships, and professional certifications such as Junior Public Relations (PERHUMAS/LSP PRI) and Digital English Journalism Certification from The Jakarta Post Foundation.
lecturers: Dr. Nila Krisnawati Hidayat, SE., MM — Dean of Faculty of Business and Communication
Deborah Nauli S., Ph.D — Senior Lecturer of Global Strategic Communications
Aulia Putri Meidina, S.Sos., M.A — Lecturer of Global Strategic Communications

Hotel and Tourism Management.description: The Hotel and Tourism Management program at Swiss German University offers a Bachelor’s Degree with opportunities to study and complete internship programs in Germany, Switzerland, or other international destinations. Through a double degree collaboration with the International Management Institute (IMI) Switzerland, students learn in one of the world’s leading hospitality environments. Graduates earn degrees from SGU, IMI, and IMI’s partner university, equipping them with the skills and qualifications to enter the international hospitality industry.
lecturers: Dr. Nila Krisnawati Hidayat, SE., MM — Dean of Faculty of Business and Communication
Robert La Are SST. Par, M. Par. — Head
Rano Abryanto — Deputy Head

International Culinary Business.description: The International Culinary Business program, offered in partnership with the International Management Institute (IMI) Switzerland, provides a double degree education that blends practical culinary training with business management. Students take culinary courses with experienced SGU lecturers in Indonesia and world-class European culinary training in Switzerland. The curriculum develops advanced culinary techniques and entrepreneurial skills to prepare students as future leaders and innovators in the culinary industry.
lecturers: Dr. Nila Krisnawati Hidayat, SE., MM — Dean of Faculty of Business and Communication
Robert La Are SST. Par, M. Par. — Head
Rano Abryanto — Deputy Head

Pharmaceutical Engineering.description: Swiss German University (SGU) is the first and only university in Indonesia offering a Bachelor’s Degree (S1) in Pharmaceutical Chemical Engineering. This program focuses on the design, operation, and optimization of processes in the pharmaceutical industry. It prepares students for careers in pharmaceutical, chemical, herbal, and cosmetics sectors, as well as in pharmaceutical equipment and machinery companies. SGU’s Pharmaceutical Chemical Engineering program is highly valued by national and multinational industries for producing skilled, industry-ready graduates.
lecturers: Dr. Hery Sutanto, S.Si., M.Si — Dean of Faculty of Life Science & Technology

Food Technology.description: The Food Technology program at SGU covers all aspects of the food processing industry, including raw material characteristics, food packaging, storage technology, food safety, and quality assurance. Students also gain insight into product development and the economic aspects of the food business. Graduates are known for their technical expertise, teamwork skills, and readiness to enter the workforce, making them highly sought after by food and related industries in Indonesia.

Medical Biotechnology.description: The Medical Biotechnology program at SGU equips students with advanced knowledge and hands-on experience in biotechnology applications for healthcare, genetics, and pharmaceuticals. Over 3.5 years of study (2 years in Indonesia and 1.5 years in Germany), students explore genomics, bioinformatics, and biomedical data science, supported by international exposure and a double degree from Aalen University of Applied Sciences, Germany. The program prepares graduates to contribute to drug discovery, diagnostics, and healthcare innovation globally.
lecturers: Dr. Hery Sutanto, S.Si., M.Si — Dean of Faculty of Life Science & Technology

Sustainable Energy and Environment.description: The Sustainable Energy and Environment program under the Chemical Engineering Department addresses global sustainability challenges related to energy, water, and the environment. It focuses on renewable energy, energy conservation, and sustainable resource management. The program aims to produce professionals capable of driving innovation and sustainability in Indonesia and globally, contributing to cleaner energy solutions and environmental protection.
